intro: Schizenterospermum rotundifolium, commonly known as the Mexican red cedar, is a member of the Burseraceae family and is native to Mexico and Central America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has simple, alternate, ovate to elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are inconspicuous, and it produces small, woody fruits containing several seeds. The tree is valued for its durable wood and is also used in traditional medicine.
